channel.title: Comments on: Upgrading from MVC3 to MVC4 and MVC4 Async
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Enrico
item.dc:creator: Enrico
item.description: Hi Eli, first thank you for your time! Well, my tests where made on an i7 laptop with decent disk and on loopback interface, probably I would need to setup a cloud VM to do some further testing. Actually I am working on a major refactoring, this system was born during the travels to meet my girlfriend mostly as a proof of concept so i'm restructuring everything to unit test every needed part. But if you'd like to take a look there is the demo repositiory on github (https://github.com/endaroza/Node.Cs.MusicStore) and the documentation (http://www.kendar.org/?p=/dotnet/nodecs). Let me know :) PS Any suggestion, even creepy, is more than welcome!! Enrico
item.content:encoded:
Hi Eli, first thank you for your time!
Well, my tests where made on an i7 laptop with decent disk and on loopback interface, probably I would need to setup a cloud VM to do some further testing.
Actually I am working on a major refactoring, this system was born during the travels to meet my girlfriend mostly as a proof of concept so i’m restructuring everything to unit test every needed part. But if you’d like to take a look there is the demo repositiory on github (https://github.com/endaroza/Node.Cs.MusicStore) and the documentation (http://www.kendar.org/?p=/dotnet/nodecs).
Let me know ðŸ™‚ PS Any suggestion, even creepy, is more than welcome!!
Enrico

item.title: By: Eli Weinstock-Herman (tarwn)
item.dc:creator: Eli Weinstock-Herman (tarwn)
item.description: Hey Enrico, I'd love to take a look. Most of the tests above are more for comparison to one another than to another environment. That VM is basically running on a single core with the a database on a neighboring VM, both probably fighting over the same disk IO, etc. It's useful enough to see major behavior changes from run to run on the same 'hardware', but probably not something I would compare to another system.
item.content:encoded: Hey Enrico, I’d love to take a look. Most of the tests above are more for comparison to one another than to another environment. That VM is basically running on a single core with the a database on a neighboring VM, both probably fighting over the same disk IO, etc. It’s useful enough to see major behavior changes from run to run on the same ‘hardware’, but probably not something I would compare to another system.

item.title: By: Enrico
item.dc:creator: Enrico
item.description: Hi, I have just developed an application server similar to Owin but with the Node.Js "thread free" approach, and ported the MvcMusicStore to it (on Github</a>). Actually i reached consistently from 350-400 requests/sec with JMeter on dynamic content. While searching for perf.test i've seen your article and i would like to ask you what you think about it. Kind regards, Enrico
item.content:encoded:
Hi,
I have just developed an application server similar to Owin but with the Node.Js “thread free” approach, and ported the MvcMusicStore to it (on Github). Actually i reached consistently from 350-400 requests/sec with JMeter on dynamic content. While searching for perf.test i’ve seen your article and i would like to ask you what you think about it.
Kind regards,
Enrico
